definition: enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
Raise the Red Lantern (1991), movie by Zhang Yimou 張藝謀|张艺谋[Zhang1 Yi4 mou2]
pinyin: Da4 hong2 Deng1 long2 Gao1 gao1 Gua4

sentences.english: Nina needs nine knitting needles to knit naughty Nita's knickers nicely.
sentences.chinese: 妮娜需要九個編織針爲淘氣的尼特編織漂亮的燈籠褲。

sentences.english: The men rippled farther outward, lighting lanterns and moving into the gorge.
sentences.chinese: 人們向更遠的地方找去，點起了燈籠，走進了峽谷。

sentences.english: They have performed really, really well, ' according to buying director Holli Rogers.
sentences.chinese: 該網站採購主管羅傑斯說，燈籠褲賣的真的非常好。

sentences.english: They certainly did not wear bloomers and go fishing.
sentences.chinese: 她們絕對不能穿燈籠褲，更不應該去釣魚。

sentences.english: "Light your lanthorn, old man, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “老頭兒，把你的燈籠點亮，”他說。

sentences.english: This trick also works with a geometric lantern or terrarium.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的法子也適用於幾何形的燈籠或玻璃容器。

sentences.english: The lawn was again searched with a lantern .
sentences.chinese: 她們又打着燈籠，把草坪搜了一遍。

sentences.english: Chinese lanterns hang from the ceilings of the main entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 在正門入口處，大紅的中國燈籠高高懸掛着。

sentences.english: Cut all the bell peppers into pieces.
Some people go to the lively streets to pick a personal favorite.
sentences.chinese: 或者到熱鬧的燈市上挑選自己喜愛的燈籠。

sentences.english: Some children make lanterns out of pumpkins at Hallowe'en.
sentences.chinese: 有些兒童在萬聖節前夕用南瓜做燈籠。

sentences.english: Core, seed, de-vein and cut the peppers into thin strips.
sentences.chinese: 把燈籠椒去核，去子，去蒂，並切成細條狀。

sentences.english: Children will play with their own toy lanterns happily. At night the moon is usually round and bright.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們會高開心興地玩他們的玩具燈籠。

sentences.english: Bright red, like a string of lanterns, pretty great.
sentences.chinese: 紅通通的，像一串串燈籠，好看極了。

sentences.english: Tracy: On the night of the festival, people go on streets with a variety of lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節的晚上，人們會提着各式各樣的燈籠上街。

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
